intro: Glochidion urophylloides, commonly known as the broad-leaf glochidion, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
